GetDir(Dir: str) → str[source]¶

Return path toward directory. Example: CurrentProject.GetDir(‘InputDir’) returns /path/to/projects/InputDir.

Parameters

Dir (str) – InputDir or GridDir or SaveDir or RunDir

Returns

Path toward directory

Return type

str

GetPath(Name: str = None, RootPath: str = None) → str[source]¶

Return the path of the project folder.

If no project name or rootpath is provided, name and rootpath are the ones from the instance.

Parameters

  • Name (str, optional) – project name, defaults to None

  • RootPath (str, optional) – project rootpath, defaults to None

Returns

path of the project folder.

Return type

str

GatherData(**kwargs)¶

Get a list of variable names from a data set/or and a list of variable name and return a dictionary with variable names as keys and variable values as values.

Parameters

  • DataSetName (str or None, optional) – Name of a data set. Defaults to None.

  • ExtraVars (list(str), optional) – List of variable names. Defaults to [].

Returns

dictionary dict[variable name]=variable value.

Print(**kwargs)¶

Print function allowing to print with the UBox prefix.

Example

>>> UBox.Print('Hello')
[UBox] Hello
ProcessVarList(**kwargs)¶

Add UEDGE package in front variable names when variable is part of an UEDGE pakage.

Parameters

  • VarList (list(str)) – DESCRIPTION.

  • Verbose (bool, optional) – DESCRIPTION. Defaults to False.

Example
